alert.note: Alert for Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:17PM EDT until July 14 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR WAYNE AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHTENAW COUNTIES... At 417 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Greenfield Village to near Romulus to near Carleton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Taylor and Greenfield Village around 420 PM EDT. Dearborn around 425 PM EDT. Flat Rock, Detroit and Wyandotte around 430 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit and Trenton around 435 PM EDT. Grosse Ile and Belle Isle around 440 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Melvindale, Whittaker, Gibraltar, New Boston, Rockwood, Harper Woods, Westland, Grosse Pointe Shores, Ecorse and Grosse Pointe Woods. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
